intro: Ourisia coccinea subsp. coccinea, commonly known as the red-flowered ourisia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers, which are usually red or orange-red, bloom in spring and are adapted for pollination by birds and insects. The subspecies is distinguished by its compact growth habit and vibrant, long-lasting floral display.
